Job Title: Water Resources Engineer

Location: Christiansburg, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Design, Engineering, Science

Description:
Job Description

NXL a division of Kleinfelder, is a multidisciplinary professional services firm offering a broad range of services to include consulting, engineering, environmental, planning, design and construction services throughout the Mid-Atlantic region. With a dedicated staff of over 500 technical and administrative personnel, we provide our clients with quality, innovative and value-added professional services in many specialized areas. Orientated around our employees first, NXL provides competitive salaries and an excellent comprehensive benefits package which includes a 401k retirement plan, paid holidays, paid leave time and various employee perks and discounts. In addition to offering a challenging and diverse work environment, NXL's culture encourages community service, continued learning, personal growth and fun!

 NXL is seeking a Water Resources Engineer to work at our Christiansburg, VA office on a wide range of interesting projects including NPDES/ TMDL, stormwater management, water resources, and transportation related projects throughout the Mid-Atlantic region. 

 Qualified applicants must have: 

 5 to 10 years of project experience in water resources engineering  Bachelor of Science Degree in Civil, Environmental, or other related Engineering with an emphasis in water resources  Excellent written and oral communication skills  Strong motivation to develop a range of water resources design skills and to work with a team approach  Valid driver's license with demonstrated safe driving practices 

 Desired (preferred) qualifications include: 

 Experience using MicroStation, OpenRoads, AutoCAD, or ArcMAP/GIS  Completion of (or plan to complete) the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE/EIT) Exam  Related MDOT design experience  Maryland design experience for stormwater management, erosion and sediment control, hydrologic/ hydraulic modeling, or NPDES/ TMDL related services 

 Some typical types of work assignments for this position are outlined below  .

 Prepare designs for drainage, stormwater management and erosion and sediment control  Perform hydrologic and hydraulic modeling analyses  Perform field investigations and evaluate existing conditions  Prepare engineering documents (plans, specifications, estimates) for review and approval  Assist with permitting for local, state, and federal agency approvals  Occasionally travel to project/client sites to complete tasks or attend meetings 

NXL is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans (Compliant with the new VEVRAA and Section 503 rules)

NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES

Please note that NXL/Kleinfelder does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, Kleinfelder will not consider or agree to payment for any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, Kleinfelder explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resume, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Kleinfelder.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
